bibl.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Commission
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States Commissionary Court Before James G Swan Commisioner
United States of America Territory of Washington 3rd Judicial Distris} ss
The President of the United States of America to the Marshal of the United States in and for said Territory Greeting.
United States vs. Leonard Martin. Selling & disposing of sohisky to Indians Comitment

Whereas, Complaint has been made before James S Swan a commision of this US District Court of the 3rd Judicial District WT upon the oath of JGClinger that Leonard Martin late of said district did on the the 30th of Aril AD 1885 commit the appease of setting or disposing of wiskey to Indidan County to the form of the states in such case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the United States; and the said Leonard Martin having been brought before said Commissioner in peformance of a warrant of arrest issued upon said complaint and being examined concerning the charges alleged against him required to give bail in the sworn of one hundred dollars for his appearance before the US Distrct Court for the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Trritory holding terms at Port Townsend on the fourth Monday of August AD 1885 being this 24th fay of said warrant on this first day of the next term thereof with which requirement he has failed to comply.

There are therefore to command you to receive the said Leonard Martin into your custody ther to remain within discharged or recomend by due couse of law
In witness where of I have hereto set my hand at my office in said district this fact day of May AD 1885
James G Swan US Comission 3rd Judicial Dist W.T.
US Commissions Court James G Swan Comsision The United States vs Leonard martin } Selling Whiskey vs Indians
Commitmend Issued May 1st 1885 James G Swan Commission Command fees Warrant of Commitment 1.00 filing .10 $1.10
No806 I reserved the within commitment this 1st day of May AD 1885 and Served the same by commiting this within named Leonard Martin to the County jail of Jefferson County W.T.
J.W. George U.S. Marshal By J. G. Clinger Deputy
